plugins.name: Map Designer
plugins.description:
Map Designer simplifies the process of creating stunning, data-driven maps directly in Figma. This plug in is in development and feedback, suggestions and comments are very welcome.


  1. Collection of Map Projections: Choose from a wide range of map projections to suit your specific needs: currently supported projections include Orthographic, Mercator, Equal Earth, and Geo Conic map projections.
  2. Customizable Colors: Tailor your maps to your brand or project with a full spectrum of color options.
  3. Data-Driven Design: Upload your own data file or use an example dataset to visualize information on the map
  4. Vectors for Easy Editing: Once the map is created, you can directly edit and scale the generated map within your Figma page.
plugins.tagline: Create and customize stunning vector maps

plugins.description:
Capture your Figma prototype flows effortlessly.


FlowShot turns your interactive designs into smooth, high-quality videos with just a few clicks. No screen recording, no cropping, no stress.


Powered by an open-source core using Playwright, TypeScript, and FFmpeg and built to scale, FlowShot lets you export your prototype flows exactly as they look and feel inside Figma.


Whether you're a designer sharing interactions, or a developer demoing a product, FlowShot gives you clean visuals you can trust.


Customize export settings

Record any flow, in any size

Use locally or connect to your own server


Free, open source, and built by someone who needed this tool too.

plugins.name: Air App
plugins.description:
Welcome to the world of the Air Figma plugin! This plugin allows quick, seamless transfer of files between your Air workspace and the Figma file you are working in.


Youll be able to browse your boards and libraries to find an asset to drop into your design. Once youre done creating, export your work right back to Air to keep it organized.


How it works:

  1. Sign up for Air if you havent already
  2. Upload and organize your content in your workspace
  3. Install the Air Plugin in Figma
  4. Drop relevant assets into your design files
  5. Export creative work back to Air


For support or further questions, reach out to help@air.inc any time!
plugins.tagline: Drop files from Air into Figma and vice versa!

plugins.name: Figma Variable Macros
plugins.description:
Variable Formula

Ever find yourself needing a bit of magic to implement layout values calculated from design tokens? Wondering how you can maintain your design intent in these situations? Variable Formula is the solution: They enable computation from your design tokens, ensuring your design intent remains steadfast and clear.


Variable Printf

Tired of the exhausting task of documenting design tokens on Figma? Finding it painful to display raw values and maintain synchronization? It's time to bring in a tried-and-true method. Welcome the age-old 'printf' into your Figma workflow, one-click display synchronization of design token values.


https://github.com/malangcat/figma-variable-macros

Manage local and remote libraries from a single, always-active interface.

plugins.name: Octopus.do to Figma by Vizioz
plugins.description:
Simplify your design workflow with the Octopus.do to Figma wireframe importing plugin from Vizioz. This plugin allows you to import wireframe designs from Octopus.do directly into Figma, transforming lo-fi wireframe diagrams into fully realized Figma designs.


Key Features

Effortless Import: Quickly bring your Octopus.do wireframes into Figma with just a few clicks.

Auto-Matching: The plugin automatically matches Octopus.do wireframe components to your pre-created Figma designs, saving you time and effort.

Customizable Grid: Create a grid of frames for each wireframe component from Octopus.do, enabling you to design your own Figma wireframe blocks for future imports.


Why Use Octopus.do to Figma Wireframe Importer?

  1. Streamline your design process by integrating wireframes from Octopus.do directly into Figma.
  2. Save time with the automatic matching of wireframe components to Figma designs.
  3. Customize and organize your wireframe blocks for easier and more efficient design work.


Transform your wireframes into polished designs effortlessly with the "Octopus.do to Figma by Vizioz" plugin. Try it today and elevate your design workflow!


Documentation

Please read the documentation :)


Have any feedback or issues?

Feel free to contact me via Discord or on X ( formally Twitter )
plugins.tagline: Generate Figma Wireframes from Octopus.do lo-fi wireframes.

plugins.name: Polipo  Keep Figma and product synchronized, in real time.
plugins.description:
Complex designs, happy developers.


Implement any design in just a few lines of code.

Keep Figma and product synchronized, in real-time.


Works with: Figma, React, Next.js, Remix, Gatsby, HTML5 and CSS3.


Go to polipo.io to learn about Polipo and book a demo, or watch our video.


The 1st Figma Compiler

Polipo runs on the developers computer and compiles Figma designs instantly into HTML and responsive CSS, rendered via React.


Here is how to use Polipo:


1. Create a design

Design a screen or component, with a single or multiple variants


2. Connect it to code

Customize responsiveness, sizing, hover states, and more


3. Add logic with React

Add custom tags, attributes, event listeners or dynamic data


4. Develop and iterate

Design changes are reflected in the product instantly


5. Build for production

Export everything from Figma without leaving the command line


6. Your product is live

Deploy optimized and responsive HTML/CSS with your React logic


Web development, just great

Deliver sooner, keeping both designers and developers engaged.

Get the best out of your team.


Real-time Figma Synchronization

Preview design changes instantly in your browser, thanks to our real-time Figma synchronization. Every adjustment in Figma is reflected in your web application in less than 1s, making collaboration truly seamless.


Single Source of Truth

Polipo ensures that your design and your product stay perfectly aligned. Figma becomes the single source of truth for layouts and visual, while code stays the single source of truth for interactions, data flow and logic. You no longer have to worry about outdated components or conflicting versions.


No Generated Code

Polipo isnt a code generator its a compiler. It takes Figma designs along with your handcrafted code to produce optimized HTML and CSS on the fly. Say goodbye to maintaining mountains of auto-generated code, and focus on what really matters.


Launch Today, not in Months

Turn a complex design into a live application in just a few seconds. You can go from design to deployment in a single day, launching products that are visually stunning and completely on-brand without months-long delays.


Seamless Collaboration

Designers and developers work together from day one. No more time-consuming hand-offs: every update made in Figma can be automatically synchronized with your product, allowing both teams to iterate without friction.


Loved by Developers

Polipo puts developers in control. Specify exactly which elements to extract from Figma and how to make them dynamic, and export optimized code right from the command line. Developers retain the flexibility to tweak and customize every detail.


Pixel-perfect, effortlessly.

With Polipo, even the most intricate designs are rendered exactly as intended, without disrupting your codebase. Designers no longer need to compromise their vision to meet development requirements, and can just focus on creating stunning designs.


Responsive by Design

Responsiveness is crafted directly in Figma. Designers can use auto-layout, variants, variables, and breakpoints to ensure their designs adapt beautifully across all screen sizes. Polipo automatically compiles this logic into a unified markup and responsive CSS.


Focus on Logic, not Pixels

Developers can focus on the core logic and business-critical functionality of your applications, without getting bogged down in design details. Polipo handles the pixel-perfect translation, leaving you to concentrate on the data and interactions.


Predictable and Reliable

Polipos algorithm guarantees accuracy. It doesnt rely on AI, so you can trust it to generate correct, optimized code every single time. Its designed to run locally and quickly, giving developers full control over the process while ensuring a reliable output.


Keep your Data Safe

Polipo runs entirely on your local machine, meaning your design files and code never leave your environment. This ensures complete control and protection of your sensitive data. Ideal for enterprises requiring high levels of security and compliance.


Flexible for Any Project

Whether you're building a landing page, an e-commerce platform, or a complex enterprise application, Polipo speeds up your workflow, helping you deliver faster without compromising quality.


Simple pricing for everyone

Polipo doubles the productivity of your team, at a fixed price.

Go to polipo.io to check our pricing.


Frequently Asked Questions

Here are the answers to the most common questions from our clients.


What is the quality of the compiled code?

Polipo compiles efficient markup and CSS, optimizing the HTML by removing duplicates and redundant elements, even when components have multiple variants in Figma. The compiled CSS uses selectors and media queries effectively, adapting the design to different screen sizes, color schemes, hover states, and more. Since Polipo focuses on producing target code not source code there's no need for you to maintain it, allowing us to prioritize speed and accuracy.


What about responsive design?

Responsiveness is built directly into Figma using auto-layout, breakpoints, and variants. Developers can refine responsiveness further with custom CSS when needed.


What happens in production?

To deploy for staging or production, the compiled markup and CSS are exported and added to your codebase via Git. In production mode, there is no longer any connection to Figma or Polipo, same as a traditional code-based implementation. New design changes in Figma are not automatically reflected in production until they are deployed by a developer.


What are people building with Polipo?

Polipo can be used for all web-based products based on Figma designs. Our most common use case is building marketing and e-commerce websites with a high level of customization and dynamic or CMS-provided data. The most common framework used with Polipo is Next.js.


Can I use it for prototyping?

Yes! Polipo makes prototyping faster by quickly turning your designs into live applications. You can use the prototype as a foundation for your final product or switch to a traditional development approach later, depending on your needs.


What is the runtime overhead?

None. The generation of markup and CSS happens at build time. In production, markup is rendered via a direct translation to JSX, with negligible runtime cost.


Is it optimized for SEO?

Yes. Polipo gives developers full control over SEO by allowing them to customize semantic markup, including tag names and attributes.


What about workflow, CI/CD, and versioning?

Figma designs are treated like traditional assets (images, SVGs, fonts, etc.). Compiled markup and CSS are versioned in Git alongside your application code and can be processed by CI/CD pipelines. Figma files themselves can be managed through native Figma branching and versioning or with a manual workflow.


Does it use AI?

No, our code generation is completely procedural.


Which frameworks do you support?

We support React, Next.js, Remix, and Gatsby. We also have preview versions for Vue.js and Angular, supported on a project-by-project basis.


Do you provide support?

Yes, we offer dedicated support for teams. Contact our sales team to learn more about our support options.


Need to move fast?

Go to polipo.io and book a demo or watch our video.

115309.name: Polipo  Keep Figma and product synchronized, in real time.
115309.description:
Complex designs, happy developers.


Implement any design in just a few lines of code.

Keep Figma and product synchronized, in real-time.


Works with: Figma, React, Next.js, Remix, Gatsby, HTML5 and CSS3.


Go to polipo.io to learn about Polipo and book a demo, or watch our video.


The 1st Figma Compiler

Polipo runs on the developers computer and compiles Figma designs instantly into HTML and responsive CSS, rendered via React.


Here is how to use Polipo:


1. Create a design

Design a screen or component, with a single or multiple variants


2. Connect it to code

Customize responsiveness, sizing, hover states, and more


3. Add logic with React

Add custom tags, attributes, event listeners or dynamic data


4. Develop and iterate

Design changes are reflected in the product instantly


5. Build for production

Export everything from Figma without leaving the command line


6. Your product is live

Deploy optimized and responsive HTML/CSS with your React logic


Web development, just great

Deliver sooner, keeping both designers and developers engaged.

Get the best out of your team.


Real-time Figma Synchronization

Preview design changes instantly in your browser, thanks to our real-time Figma synchronization. Every adjustment in Figma is reflected in your web application in less than 1s, making collaboration truly seamless.


Single Source of Truth

Polipo ensures that your design and your product stay perfectly aligned. Figma becomes the single source of truth for layouts and visual, while code stays the single source of truth for interactions, data flow and logic. You no longer have to worry about outdated components or conflicting versions.


No Generated Code

Polipo isnt a code generator its a compiler. It takes Figma designs along with your handcrafted code to produce optimized HTML and CSS on the fly. Say goodbye to maintaining mountains of auto-generated code, and focus on what really matters.


Launch Today, not in Months

Turn a complex design into a live application in just a few seconds. You can go from design to deployment in a single day, launching products that are visually stunning and completely on-brand without months-long delays.


Seamless Collaboration

Designers and developers work together from day one. No more time-consuming hand-offs: every update made in Figma can be automatically synchronized with your product, allowing both teams to iterate without friction.


Loved by Developers

Polipo puts developers in control. Specify exactly which elements to extract from Figma and how to make them dynamic, and export optimized code right from the command line. Developers retain the flexibility to tweak and customize every detail.


Pixel-perfect, effortlessly.

With Polipo, even the most intricate designs are rendered exactly as intended, without disrupting your codebase. Designers no longer need to compromise their vision to meet development requirements, and can just focus on creating stunning designs.


Responsive by Design

Responsiveness is crafted directly in Figma. Designers can use auto-layout, variants, variables, and breakpoints to ensure their designs adapt beautifully across all screen sizes. Polipo automatically compiles this logic into a unified markup and responsive CSS.


Focus on Logic, not Pixels

Developers can focus on the core logic and business-critical functionality of your applications, without getting bogged down in design details. Polipo handles the pixel-perfect translation, leaving you to concentrate on the data and interactions.


Predictable and Reliable

Polipos algorithm guarantees accuracy. It doesnt rely on AI, so you can trust it to generate correct, optimized code every single time. Its designed to run locally and quickly, giving developers full control over the process while ensuring a reliable output.


Keep your Data Safe

Polipo runs entirely on your local machine, meaning your design files and code never leave your environment. This ensures complete control and protection of your sensitive data. Ideal for enterprises requiring high levels of security and compliance.


Flexible for Any Project

Whether you're building a landing page, an e-commerce platform, or a complex enterprise application, Polipo speeds up your workflow, helping you deliver faster without compromising quality.


Simple pricing for everyone

Polipo doubles the productivity of your team, at a fixed price.

Go to polipo.io to check our pricing.


Frequently Asked Questions

Here are the answers to the most common questions from our clients.


What is the quality of the compiled code?

Polipo compiles efficient markup and CSS, optimizing the HTML by removing duplicates and redundant elements, even when components have multiple variants in Figma. The compiled CSS uses selectors and media queries effectively, adapting the design to different screen sizes, color schemes, hover states, and more. Since Polipo focuses on producing target code not source code there's no need for you to maintain it, allowing us to prioritize speed and accuracy.


What about responsive design?

Responsiveness is built directly into Figma using auto-layout, breakpoints, and variants. Developers can refine responsiveness further with custom CSS when needed.


What happens in production?

To deploy for staging or production, the compiled markup and CSS are exported and added to your codebase via Git. In production mode, there is no longer any connection to Figma or Polipo, same as a traditional code-based implementation. New design changes in Figma are not automatically reflected in production until they are deployed by a developer.


What are people building with Polipo?

Polipo can be used for all web-based products based on Figma designs. Our most common use case is building marketing and e-commerce websites with a high level of customization and dynamic or CMS-provided data. The most common framework used with Polipo is Next.js.


Can I use it for prototyping?

Yes! Polipo makes prototyping faster by quickly turning your designs into live applications. You can use the prototype as a foundation for your final product or switch to a traditional development approach later, depending on your needs.


What is the runtime overhead?

None. The generation of markup and CSS happens at build time. In production, markup is rendered via a direct translation to JSX, with negligible runtime cost.


Is it optimized for SEO?

Yes. Polipo gives developers full control over SEO by allowing them to customize semantic markup, including tag names and attributes.


What about workflow, CI/CD, and versioning?

Figma designs are treated like traditional assets (images, SVGs, fonts, etc.). Compiled markup and CSS are versioned in Git alongside your application code and can be processed by CI/CD pipelines. Figma files themselves can be managed through native Figma branching and versioning or with a manual workflow.


Does it use AI?

No, our code generation is completely procedural.


Which frameworks do you support?

We support React, Next.js, Remix, and Gatsby. We also have preview versions for Vue.js and Angular, supported on a project-by-project basis.


Do you provide support?

Yes, we offer dedicated support for teams. Contact our sales team to learn more about our support options.

Go to polipo.io and book a demo or watch our video.

plugins.name: Design Asset ProductionDAP
plugins.description:
Introduction:

Obtain all solid color style data with one click and save it to variables in Figma.

Main functions:

Simple and easy to use: users only need to click the button of the plug-in to complete the query and export of color styles.

Method of use:

  1. Open the Figma document.
  2. Install and run the plug-in (Design Asset Production(DAP)).
  3. Click the "colors style to Variable" button in the plug-in interface.
  4. The plug-in will automatically get the solid color style and add the name and color value to the variable.
  5. The query and export results are saved in variables in the plug-in and are available to the user at any time.

About the Author:

Hello everyone, my English name is Cheung, Chinese name is Gong Chang Zhang, I am an Internet experience designer.

I loveFigma also uses a large number of plug-ins at ordinary times, but I find that there are always some needs that cannot meet my needs, so I hope to make a plug-in to satisfy myself, and I don't like to switch plug-ins frequently. I hope the plug-in is in a permanent open state to meet my efficient operation.

This is my first time to learn code compilation to develop plug-ins. Maybe plug-ins are relatively simple because I am still learning to develop them., the development progress will be slower, but I believe this plug-in can satisfy more people, welcomeEveryone to use!

I also hope that some developers will help me make more creative functions to reduce the working time of designers and developers.

Update log:

NEW

wSupport for user-defined variable collection names

Optimization

Prompt for successful variable creation

Create failed without closing plug-in

  • Successfully created without closing the plug-in


Follow-up planning

At present, it is only the first version, with only variable-related content. In the future, more functions of variables and functions to improve efficiency when making components will be added one after another. The future plan is as follows:

Maintaining binding to styles when importing variables, breaking binding of styles to variables, synchronizing styles to variables, etc.

More variable support

Efficiency-enhancing features when making components

Note:

At present, it is only the first version, and more functions will be added one after another in the future.

Maintain associations with styles when importing variables

More variable support

Limited by this time node, the variable support of figma is still very limited, and I will keep the plug-in updated all the time.

If you have any suggestions or ideas in the process of using it, please leave a message in the comment area and I will reply as soon as possible.

At present, the icon and cover of the plug-in have not been designed. If you are interested or have ideas or suggestions, please contact me

My email: vividzyl@gmail.com

Cheung

plugins.name: Easy QR
plugins.description:
Easy QR for Figma - Simplifying QR Code Design


Elevate your Figma experience with Easy QR, a dynamic plugin leveraging the powerful QR Code Styling library. Effortlessly generate QR codes as SVG and PNG directly within Figma, offering unparalleled flexibility and customization.


Key Features:


SVG and PNG Output: Generate QR codes in scalable SVG or high-resolution PNG formats, seamlessly integrating them into your Figma projects.


Customization Options:


  • Shapes and Colors: Modify QR code shapes and colors to align with your design aesthetic.
  • Logo Integration: Add logos to personalize QR codes, enhancing brand recognition.
  • Background Options: Choose between backgrounds or go for a clean, transparent look.
  • Correction Level: Ensure optimal scan performance by adjusting the error correction level to meet your specific requirements.


Trial Period:

Enjoy a 7-day trial of Easy QR, exploring its full range of features at no cost.


Activation:

After the trial period, a one-time payment of $10 is required to activate Easy QR. Please note that local taxes may apply to the payment.


How to Get Started:

  • Generate QR codes with ease directly within your Figma workspace.
  • Customize shapes, colors, logos, and more to suit your design needs.
  • Experience the convenience of QR code creation and modification without leaving Figma.


Enhance Your Workflow:


Whether you're designing marketing materials, product packaging, or interactive presentations, Easy QR streamlines the QR code creation process, empowering you to create visually appealing and functional designs effortlessly.


Upgrade Today:

Note: Easy QR is designed for Figma and built on the QR Code Styling library to ensure reliability and efficiency in QR code generation.

plugins.name: Word Hugger
plugins.description:
Word Hugger scans all the text elements on the current Figma page, identifying and adjusting paragraphs that end with short, isolated words commonly referred to as "orphans." By converting the space before these orphans into a non-breaking space, the code ensures that these words are not isolated at the end of a paragraph.


In typography, an orphan is a single word at the end of a paragraph. Orphans can disrupt the visual rhythm and balance of a page, making the layout appear uneven and possibly hindering readability. Adjusting them ensures a more aesthetically pleasing and cohesive presentation of text, offering readers a smoother experience.
plugins.tagline: Every word deserves company.

plugins.name: Variable Scope Manager
plugins.description:
What's this nifty plugin all about?

This plugin is your new best friend for managing variable scopes in Figma. It's designed to help you quickly filter, search, and modify the scopes of your local variables without breaking a sweat.


What can you do with it?

  1. Filter variables by type: Whether you're looking for NUMBER, COLOR, STRING this plugin's got you covered.
  2. Search like a pro: Need to find a specific variable? Just start typing, and the plugin will show you matching results in real-time.
  3. Bulk scope changes: Want to change the scopes for multiple variables at once? No problem! Search for the variables you want to modify, choose the new scopes, and voila!
  4. Quick overview: Get a bird's-eye view of all your variables, their types, and current scopes in one convenient list.


How to use it?

  1. Fire up the plugin
  2. Choose the variable type you want to work with
  3. Use the search box to filter the variables you want to edit
  4. Apply new scopes.


This plugin is perfect for keeping your variables organized and your workflow smooth. So go ahead, give it a spin, and take control of your Figma variables like never before!


Don't miss out on these other pro tools:


Variables everywhere

Quickly scan your selection for variables you actually forgot to apply


Brutal

A super light-weight plugin to remove, detach styles, variables etc

plugins.name: Codyhouse Color Importer
plugins.description:
Import your colors from Codyhouse to Figma like never before!


Features:

This plugin can:

  • Import colors from Codyhouse: UI Framework -> Globals -> Colors
  • Create "color sample" circles from imported color
  • Split color to themes



How to use?

  1. Open Codyhouse and go to color editor (UI Framework -> Globals -> Colors).

  4. Open Figma and run this plugin.

What can you achieve with Commentify?


  • Streamlined annotations: effortlessly create and manage annotations. Categorize your comments based on various aspects (poeditor, accessibility and analytics).
  • Enhanced portability: stop losing comments when relocating Figma files. Commentify ensures your annotations travel with you.
  • Instant access: access team members' comments directly from the left sidebar menu. Commentify swiftly directs you to pertinent information.
  • Developer mode compatibility: integrate commentify into your development workflow.


Commentify is the tool you've been searching for to elevate communication and collaboration in your Figma design projects.


Contribute or make request in the GitHub project.


Welcome to the community!

plugins.name: Style Reptile: Figma to CSS Extractor
plugins.description:
Style Reptile: Figma to CSS Extractor


This plugin generates CSS styles from Figma styles and variables in adaptive way: using mobile (m) and desktop (d) values:

  • Spaces
  • Typography


Spaces


Input

  1. Create a collection named screen
  2. Create a 2 modes in it: m for mobile values and d for desktop values
  3. Add spacing variables prefixed with space- of 'Number' type to use as CSS variables in the generation output
  4. Run the plugin


Output

As an output the following will be generated:

1. Root variables in the config.css file:

:root {
  --space-xxl: 9rem; /* 1rem = 10px to convenient conversion */
  --space-xl: 6rem;
  --space-l: 4rem;
  --space-m: 3rem;
  --space-s: 2.5rem;
  --space-xs: 2rem;
  --space-xxs: 1.5rem;
}

@media (min-width: 640px) {
  :root {
    --space-xxl: 15rem;
    --space-xl: 10rem;
    --space-l: 8rem;
    --space-m: 6rem;
    --space-s: 4rem;
    --space-xs: 3rem;
    --space-xxs: 2rem;
  }
}

2. Paddings and margins classnames in paddings.css and margins.css:

/* All */

.p-xxl {
  padding: var(--space-xxl);
}
.p-xl {
  padding: var(--space-xl);
}
/* ... */

/* X */

.px-xxl {
  padding-left: var(--space-xxl);
  padding-right: var(--space-xxl);
}
/* ... */

/* Top */

.pt-xxl {
  padding-top: var(--space-xxl);
}
/* ... and so on */
  • p-* / m-* padding / margin all
  • px-* / mx-* padding / margin left and right
  • py-* / my-* padding / margin top and bottom
  • pt-* / mt-* padding / margin top
  • pr-* / mr-* padding / margin right
  • pb-* / mb-* padding / margin bottom
  • pl-* / ml-* padding / margin left


Typography


Input

  1. Name the text styles by following the pattern m/* for mobile and d/* for desktop
  2. Run the plugin


Output

As an output the following will be generated:

1. Root variables in the config.css file:

:root {
  --text-xxl: normal 400 4rem/1 'Inter';
  --text-xl: normal 400 3rem/1 'Inter';
  --text-l: normal 400 1.8rem/1.05 'Inter';
  --text-m: normal 400 1.3rem/1.2 'Inter';
}

@media (min-width: 640px) {
  :root {
    --text-xxl: normal 400 9.6rem/1 'Inter';
    --text-xl: normal 400 6.4rem/1 'Inter';
    --text-l: normal 400 3.6rem/1.05 'Inter';
    --text-m: normal 400 2.2rem/1.2 'Inter';
  }
}

2. Text-style classnames in `typography.css`:

.text-xxl {
  font: var(--text-xxl);
}
.text-xl {
  font: var(--text-xl);
}
.text-l {
  font: var(--text-l);
}
.text-m {
  font: var(--text-m);
}


Source code and more details can be found here
plugins.tagline: Generate CSS styles from Figma styles and variables in adaptive way

Select a seed color and count. Will generate a palette where each color has the same saturation and brightness of the seed. The hue gap between each sequential color will be the same. Also generates a color visible on each base color. It is the base color with a brightness divided by "Divide"

plugins.name: A11y Text
plugins.description:
A11y Text evaluates the contrast ratio between text and its background to ensure compliance with WCAG 2.1 AA and AAA guidelines.


It checks text size (small text under 18px or bold text under 14px) and large text (18px or larger, or 14px bold), verifying minimum contrast ratios of 4.5:1 for small text and 3:1 for large text (AA), and 7:1 for small text and 4.5:1 for large text (AAA).
plugins.tagline: Enhance readability, ensure accessibility.

124190.name: A11y Text
124190.description:

124190.release_notes: Fixed: Contrast check now works with text objects that are not in a frame. Contrast is checked against Page color or a Fill object behind the selected text.

plugins.name: Variables Usage Counter
plugins.description:
Variable Usage Counter is an essential Figma plugin that empowers designers by providing detailed insights into the usage of variables across their projects. Whether you're dealing with colors, strings, or numerical values, this plugin helps you maintain consistency and efficiency by tracking how and where your variables are utilized.


Key Features:

  1. In-Depth Variable Analysis: Effortlessly scan your entire Figma document to collect comprehensive data on variable usage, including the frequency of use and specific locations within your design.
  2. User-Friendly Interface: Navigate through your variables with ease using an intuitive UI that allows filtering by usage status (used/unused) and type (color, string, number).
  3. Flexible Viewing Options: Choose between a structured view, which organizes variables by their collection, or a flat view for a straightforward list of all variables.
  4. Real-Time Feedback: Stay informed with instant updates on scanning progress and results, ensuring you always have the latest information at your fingertips.
  5. Node Highlighting: Quickly identify and highlight nodes in your design that utilize specific variables, facilitating informed design decisions.
  6. Seamless Integration: Enjoy a smooth and responsive UI that integrates effortlessly into your Figma workflow.


Variable Usage Count is the perfect tool for designers and teams aiming to maintain a high level of organization and consistency in their projects. By offering a clear overview of variable usage, this plugin helps optimize your design workflow and ensures that your projects are both efficient and visually cohesive.
plugins.tagline: Find, Count & Analyze variable usage effortlessly

plugins.name: Neumorpher
plugins.description:
Neumorpher transforms your layers into beautiful neumorphic elements with intuitive controls and real-time preview.


Neumorphic Effects

  1. Create soft, realistic neumorphic shadows that match your design
  2. Automatically analyzes and matches background colors
  3. Switch between outer and inner shadows instantly
  4. Live preview as you adjust


Intuitive Controls

  1. Interactive light source control with visual grid
  2. Depth slider for perfect shadow offsets
  3. Shadow intensity for subtle to strong effects
  4. Blur control for softer or sharper shadows


Features

  1. Smart color matching with background
  2. Proportional depth based on element size
  3. Instant toggle between outer/inner shadows
  4. Works with any Figma element that supports effects
  5. Live preview of all changes


Perfect for:

  1. Modern UI design
  2. Mobile interfaces
  3. Component libraries
  4. Light/dark mode designs
  5. Custom buttons and cards
  6. Interactive elements
  7. Soft UI patterns


Made with by Square One

plugins.name: Easy Docs
plugins.description:
Watch the demo!

Easy Docs is an open-source Figma plugin, that helps you manage documentation easily!

Features

Easy Docs lets you:

  1. Write documentation quickly with its live Editor.
  2. Generate component specs quickly with support for Design Tokens
  3. Export your documentation to a markdown, HTML, or JSON file.
  4. Copy your documentation as rich text that can seamlessly be pasted into Notion, Google Docs, Confluence, Supernova, and many more.
  5. Generate a full-fledge documentation site that can be hosted anywhere you need!

plugins.name: Genome Import
plugins.description:
Create color palettes for all themes of your design system with meaningfully weighted numbers.


The genome color tool


Easy to use

No curves, graphs, or sliders required. Just input brand colors and let Genome create tints and shades for you.


Multiple Palette Systems

Choose palette systems from the most popular design systems, or create your own starting with Univers optimization.


Built for Accessibility

Reliable Contrast Pass/Fail using CIELab L* density values as numeric weight of the palette system.


Open Source

Code for the Figma plugin and Genome web app are free for download
